div.p: A breefe Catechiſme ſo neceſſarie and eaſie to be learned euen of the ſymple ſort, that whoſoeuer can not or vvyll not attayne to the ſame, is not to be counted a good Chriſtian, much leſſe to be admitted to the Supper of the Lorde.
It standeth of three partes.

list.item: 1. The firſt ſheweth howe miſerable all men are of them ſelues.
2. The ſeconde, howe happy they are that rightly beleeue in Chriſt.
3. The thirde, what duties they owe vnto God, for his greate merye to wardes them in Chriſt Ieſus.

div.p: AT LONDON. Printed by Hugh Singleton.

q.p: Sanctifye the Lorde God in your heartes, and be ready alwayes to geue an aunſwere to euery man that aſketh you a reaſon of the hope that is in you.
And that with meekeneſſe and reacrence, hauing a good conſcience, that when they ſpeake euill of you as of euill dooers, they may be aſhamed which blame your good conuerſation in Christe.

div.head: THE FIRST PART.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: ARt thou not a ſubiect and a ſeruant vnto the Almyghtie God, and Lord of Heauen and Earth?

div.p: Aunſwere. I acknowledge and yeeld my ſelfe for euer to be his ſubiect and ſeruaunt.Exod. 20.2. Ioſ. 24.15.24. Rom. 12.16.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: Hath God giuen foorth any lawes, whereby his ſubiectes ſhoulde be wel ruled and gouerned?
Aunſvvere.

div.p: The holy ſcriptures are Gods ſtatures and lawes,Hebru. 1.12. Luk. 16.29.31 Dent. 4.13. wherein he declareth his wyll and pleaſure, the generall ſumme and effect whereof is breefely ſet foorth vnto vs in the tenne Commaundementes.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: Rehearſe the tenne Commaundementes.
Aunſwere.

div.p: i. GOD ſpake all theſe wordes and ſayd,Exod. 20.3. I am the Lorde thy GOD, thou ſhalt haue none other gods but me.

ii. Thou ſhalt not make to thy ſelfe any grauen image, nor the likeneſſe of any thing that is in heauen aboue, or in the earth beneth, or in the waters vnder the earth, thou ſhalt not bowe downe to them, nor worſhip them, for I the Lorde am a ielious God, and will vifite the ſinnes of the fathers vpon the chyldren, vnto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me, and ſhew mercie vnto thouſandes in them that loue me, and keepe my commaundements.
iii. Thou ſhalt not take the name of the Lorde thy GOD in vayne, for the Lorde will not holde him giltles, that taketh his name in vayne.

iiii. Remember that thou keepe holy the Sabboth day, ſixe dayes ſhalt thou laboure and doe all that thou haſt to doe: but the ſeuenth day is the Sabboth of the Lorde the GOD, in it thou ſhalt doe no manner of worke, thou nor thy ſonne, thy daughter,
thy man ſeruant, nor thy maydſeruant, thy cattell, nor the ſtraunger that is within thy gates: for in ſixe dayes the Lorde made Heauen and Earth, the Sea and all that in them is, wherefore the Lorde bleſſed the ſeuenth day, and hallowed it.
v. Honour thy Father and thy Mother, that thy dayes may be long in the lande, which the Lorde thy GOD geueth thee.
vi. Thou ſhalt doe no murder.
vii. Thou ſhalt not commit adulterie.
viii. Thou ſhalt not ſteale.
ix. Thou ſhalt not beare falſe witneſſe agaynſt thy neyghbour.
x. Thou ſhalt not couet thy neighbours houſe, thou ſhalt not couet thy neyghbours wyfe, nor his ſeruaunt, nor his mayde, nor his Oxe, nor his Aſſe, nor any thing that is his.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: Are you able to keepe all theſe lawes?
Aunſvvere

div.p: Euery man daily breaketh them in thought,Pſalm. 19.12. Eccleſi. 7.22. 1. Iohn. 1.8. word, and deede.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi:
What is the danger of breaking
any of theſe lawes and commaundementes of Almyghty GOD.

div.p: The iuſt wages and puniſhmēt of breaking the leaſt of Gods holy lawes,Math. 5.19.22. yea if it were but once in all my life,Rom. 6 23. and in thought onely:Ga • at. 3.10. is the loſſe of Gods fauour, the purchaſing of his heauye diſpleaſure:Iames. 2.10. which bringeth euerlaſting death both of ſoule and body.

div.head: THE SECOND PART.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: Howe ſhall you eſcape this great daunger, and feareful punishment of your ſinnes. Wyll not your good deedes ſerue to make ſome amends to GOD for your il deedes, and ſo deliuer you from this puniſhment.

div.p: Aunſvvere. My good deedes will not helpe to ſaue me from this puniſhment, nor any thing els,Ephe. 2.9. Actes. 4.1 • . Gala. 2.21. but onely the deedes of Ieſus Chriſt hath deliuered me.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: How hath Jeſus Christ ſaued and deliuered you from this great punishment of your ſinnes.

div.p: Aunſvvere. Ieſus Chriſte hath deliuered me from the puniſhment of my ſinne,1. Tim. 3.1 • . Cala. 3.13. Eſai. 53.5. becauſe he being both GOD and Man,Col. 1.19.20. hath ſuffered all the puniſhment which my ſinnes deſerued,1. Pet. 2.24. and hath fulfilled the lawe of God perfectly for me,Rom 4.25. and thereby hath reſtored me for euer to the loue and fauour of God.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: Are all then ſaued by this ſuffering & death of Chriſt.

div.p:
Aunſvvere. Only they are ſaued by Chriſt,Iohn. 3.16.3. who beleeue that he hath doone all thinges touching ſaluation, not onely for other,Gal. 2.20. Ioh. 1.20.22. but alſo euen for
them ſelues, the effect of which faith is conteyned in the Creede.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: Rehearſe the Creede.

div.p: Aunſvvere. I beleeue in God the Father Almighty maker of Heauen and Earth.Iohn. 14 1. And in Ieſus Chriſt his onely ſonne our Lorde. Whiche was conceyued by the holy Ghoſt, horne of the Virgin Marie. Suffered vnder Ponce Pilate, was crucified, dead, and buryed, he deſcended into Hell. The third day he roſe againe from the dead. He aſſended into Heauen, and ſitteth at the right hand of God the Father Almightie. From thence ſhall he come to iudge the quicke and the dead. I beléeue in the holy Ghoſt. The holy Catholicke Church. The Communion of Saintes. The forgeueneſſe of ſinnes. The reſurrection of the body. And the life euerlaſting Amen.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: By what meanes haue we ſuch a true fayth.
Aunſvvere.

div.p: It is the gyft of GOD.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: How dooth God woorke this fayth in vs.

div.p: Aunſvvere By the preaching of the woord of God.Rom. 1.12.17. Rom. 10.4.17. Iames. 1.21.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: Is this fayth fully framed, and made ſtrong in vs at the fyrſt, or in one houre.

div.p: Aunſvvere. Fayth is increaſed by little and little,1. Cor. 11.17. Galat. 4.19. Epheſi. 4.11.12.13. 1. Theſſa. 5.19.20. and made ſtrong in vs by the diligent hearing of the worde of God, and by the vſe of his Sacramentes.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: How many Sacraments are there.

div.p: Aunſvvere. There are two Sacraments, Baptiſme,Rom. 4.11. 1. Cor. 10.2.3. Math. 21.25. Matth. 28.19. Matth. 26.2.6 Acts. 2.26. and the Supper of the Lord.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: What benifite haue you by Baptiſme, and to what end ſerueth it.

div.p: Aunſvvere. By Baptiſme the holy Ghoſt aſſureth me,Acts 22.16. that as my bodye is ſprinkled with water, ſo my ſoule,1. Pet. 3.21. by the bloodſhedding of Chriſt, is ſprinckled and waſhed from all the guilte and puniſhmēt of my ſinnes,Coloſſ. 2.12. and alſo herby I profeſſe my ſelfe to dye with Chriſte, as concerning ſinne,Rom. 6.4. and liue in him as concerning righteouſneſſe.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: To what ende ſerueth the Supper of the Lorde.

div.p: Aunſvvere. In the Supper of the Lorde,Luke. 22.19.20. 1. Pet. 10.16. I am by the ſpirite of GOD aſſured, that as the breade broken, and the wine poured out be deliuered vnto me,1. Cor. 11.23.34 euen ſo was the body of Chriſt broken, and his bloude ſhed, as a full recompence to God for my ſinnes.

div.head: THE THIRD PART.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi:
For aſmuch then as God of his infinite loue, hath geuen his owne ſonne, to raunſome
vs from the power of ſinne, death, and hell, to aduaunce vs to the honour of his Children, and heires of his kingdome: ſeing it pleaſeth him to geue vs fayth, and daylye to nouriſh and encreaſe it in vs more and more: by his woorde and Sacramentes, by the which fayth we lay hold vpon Chriſte, and make him with al his merits and treaſures our owne: ſo that nowe not only alour ſinnes are remooued from vs, but alſo his righteouſnes, holineſſe, and perfection, is accounted ours
before GOD: Do you not thinke that we are very depely bound vnto him.
Aunſvvers.

div.p: Yes veryly. I am ſo much bounde to God,Pſalm. 8.5. Pſalm. 116.12 Rom. 12.1. that al my life ought to be a continual thankfulnes to his Maieſtie, for his great mercie.

p.hi: Quueſtion.
Is then this doctrine whiche ſheweth vs that we are ſaued by Jeſus Chriſt only, & not by our owne woorkes, any occaſion of wicked lyfe, as the Papiſts ſlaunder it.

div.p: Aunſvvere. This doctrine is no occaſion of wicked lyfe,Rom. 12.1. 1. Iohn. 2.1. Rom. 6.1. Titus. 2.11.12. but the greateſt reaſon to perſwade men to be diligent and zealous in good woorkes.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi:
Are there no other good deedes required of Chriſtians,
but giuing of almes, viſiting the ſycke, buylding of ſchooles, and houſes for the poore.

div.p: Aunſvvere. Math. 6.2. 1. Cor. 13.3. As theſe are good deedes, and ſuch as highly pleaſe God, being doone in ſuch maner as the worde of God dooth teache vs:Exo. 20.3.4. Math. 22.36. So are there many other much more excellent then theſe: as the pure worſhipping of God both with the ſoule and body:Iob. 13.15. truſting and dependidg of his good prouidence both in proſperitie and aduerſitie:Luk. 10.42. hearing of his holy worde:Theſ. 5.11.14. Hebre. 3.13. Coloſ. 3.16. Iacob. 5.20. exhortations and admonitions one to an other, eſpecially to ſuch as we haue ſpeciall charge ouer:1. Theſ. 5.16. Pſalm. 50.14.15. prayſing God for all his mercies, and continuall benifites powred vpon vs: and laſt of all,Iudges. 20. Ephe. 6.18. Pſalm. 50.15. Actes. 4.24. faythfull prayers for all ſuch thinges as we ſtand in neede of.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: To whom ough we to make our prayers.

div.p: Aunſvvere. We muſt pray to our louing and Almighty GOD alone, and to none but him.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: What thinges ought we to pray for.

div.p: Aunſvvere. We muſt praye,Actes. 4.29. Ephe. 6.18.19. not onely for all thinges needefull for our ſelues and the churche of GOD, but eſpecially for thoſe thinges whiche appertayne to the ſetting foorth of the glory of God, euen as we are taught in the Lordes prayer.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi: Rehearſe the Lordes prayer.

div.p: Aunſvere. Our father which art in Heauen, hallowed be thy name.Math. 6.9. Thy kingdome come. Thy wyll be done in Earth, as it i • in Heauen. Geue vs this day our daly breade. And forgeue vs our treſpaſſes, as we forgiue them that treſpaſſe againſt vs. And leade vs not into temptation But deliuer vs from euyll Amen.

p.label: Queſtion.
p.hi:
How may we be aſsured that God wyl heare vs, ſeeing we
are ſinners.

div.p: Aunſvvere. Becauſe we offer vp our prayers,Iohn. 16.29. 1. Iohn. 2.1. 1. Pet. 2.5. not in our own name, nor in the name of any creature but of the ſonne of God our Sauiour, who is alwayes in the preſence of God, to entreate his maieſtie for vs, his poore Seruauntes.
